articles.headline: I.R.S. Takes a Position on Bitcoin: It’s Property
articles.snippet: Some financial experts view the move as a way to push Bitcoin away from the fringes and into the mainstream financial system.
articles.abstract: Some financial experts view the move as a way to push Bitcoin away from the fringes and into the mainstream financial system.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:53 p.m. | The Internal Revenue Service may have just taken some of the fun out of Bitcoin. But that may mean that the virtual currency is growing up.

articles.headline: Income Equality: A Search for Consequences
articles.snippet: Social scientists, economists and other scholars have had a difficult time explaining the significance of the growing income gap.
articles.abstract: Social scientists, economists and other scholars have had a difficult time explaining the significance of the growing income gap.
articles.lead_paragraph: There are not many social scientists in the United States who have studied the United States’ widening income gap longer than Christopher S. Jencks.

articles.headline: Facebook in $2 Billion Deal for Virtual Reality Company
articles.snippet: Facebook announced that it had reached an agreement to buy Oculus VR, the maker of a virtual reality headset, in a bet that social networking will one day become an immersive, 3-D experience.
articles.abstract: Facebook announced that it had reached an agreement to buy Oculus VR, the maker of a virtual reality headset, in a bet that social networking will one day become an immersive, 3-D experience.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facebook sees the future — a 3-D virtual world where you feel as if you are hanging out with your friends rather than staring at their pictures.
articles.byline: By Nick Wingfield and Vindu Goel

articles.headline: Macau Rides High on New Round of Casino Construction
articles.snippet: A construction boom in the Asian gambling hub epitomizes the rising spending power of Chinese consumers.
articles.abstract: A construction boom in the Asian gambling hub epitomizes the rising spending power of Chinese consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: MACAU — This city on the southeast coast of China already has its own version of Venice, complete with a Grand Canal and a Rialto Bridge.

articles.headline: Nitroglycerin, a Staple of Emergency Rooms, Is in Short Supply
articles.snippet: The shortage is the latest example of how patchy the supply of some of the nation’s most critical drugs has become in recent years.
articles.abstract: The shortage is the latest example of how patchy the supply of some of the nation’s most critical drugs has become in recent years.
articles.lead_paragraph: The drug nitroglycerin has long been an emergency room staple, a front-line drug that is often the first thing doctors try when a patient shows up with a heart attack.
articles.byline: By Katie Thomas and Sabrina Tavernise

articles.headline: On Visit to China, Michelle Obama Eases In Some Political Messages
articles.snippet: What seemed to start as a spring break holiday for the first lady has turned out to be far more substantive than what the cheerful advocate of fitness and healthful eating often displays at home.
articles.abstract: What seemed to start as a spring break holiday for the first lady has turned out to be far more substantive than what the cheerful advocate of fitness and healthful eating often displays at home.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHENGDU, China — Michelle Obama’s weeklong trip to China seemed to start as a spring break holiday with her mother and daughters but has turned out to include far more substance — and politics — than the cheerful advocate of fitness and healthful eating she often displays at home.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez and Mark Landler

articles.headline: Qaeda Militants Seek Syria Base, U.S. Officials Say
articles.snippet: Intelligence assessments say that Al Qaeda’s leadership is developing a long-term plan to create cells in Syria to train Westerners to carry out plots against targets in the West.
articles.abstract: Intelligence assessments say that Al Qaeda’s leadership is developing a long-term plan to create cells in Syria to train Westerners to carry out plots against targets in the West.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Dozens of seasoned militant fighters, including some midlevel planners, have traveled to Syria from Pakistan in recent months in what American intelligence and counterterrorism officials fear is an effort to lay the foundation for future strikes against Europe and the United States.

articles.headline: Literary City, Bookstore Desert
articles.snippet: The rising cost of doing business in Manhattan is driving out many of its remaining bookstores, threatening the city’s sense of self as the center of the literary universe.
articles.abstract: The rising cost of doing business in Manhattan is driving out many of its remaining bookstores, threatening the city’s sense of self as the center of the literary universe.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Sarah McNally, the owner of McNally Jackson bookstore in Lower Manhattan, set out to open a second location, she went to a neighborhood with a sterling literary reputation, the home turf of writers from Edgar Allan Poe to Nora Ephron: the Upper West Side.

articles.headline: U.S. to Extend Sign-Up Period for Insurance
articles.snippet: The Obama administration has decided to give people more time to sign up for health insurance if they were blocked by technical problems with the federal exchange.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration has decided to give people more time to sign up for health insurance if they were blocked by technical problems with the federal exchange.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With less than a week left for people to sign up for health insurance, the Obama administration said Tuesday that it would allow more time for those who had tried to apply but were blocked by technical problems with the federal exchange.

articles.headline: Obama Renewing U.S. Commitment to NATO Alliance
articles.snippet: In a sharp rebuke, President Obama, in Brussels, denounced Russia’s takeover of Crimea and described Moscow as an out-of-touch power.
articles.abstract: In a sharp rebuke, President Obama, in Brussels, denounced Russia’s takeover of Crimea and described Moscow as an out-of-touch power.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — President Obama has spent much of his presidency mired in the challenges of a world well outside the borders of Europe — the turmoil of the Middle East, the power struggles in Asia and the terrorist threats percolating in northern Africa, Pakistan and elsewhere.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Peter Baker

articles.headline: Putting 2 Sons in Top Posts, Murdoch Guards His Dynasty
articles.snippet: Lachlan Murdoch became nonexecutive co-chairman of the News Corporation and 21st Century Fox, and James Murdoch became co-chief operating officer at 21st Century Fox.
articles.abstract: Lachlan Murdoch became nonexecutive co-chairman of the News Corporation and 21st Century Fox, and James Murdoch became co-chief operating officer at 21st Century Fox.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, Rupert Murdoch was in retreat. His media empire was consumed by a phone-hacking scandal in Britain, threatening to engulf his son and heir-apparent, James. Family resentments boiled over into public view — he was distanced from both his son Lachlan and his daughter Elisabeth, and, according to friends, his marriage to Wendi Deng was showing signs of stress. Wall Street had grown impatient with his infatuation with newspapers, as had the leadership of the company he built, News Corporation.
articles.byline: By Ravi Somaiya, David Carr and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: App Maker Buckles on 1st Day of Trading
articles.snippet: After pricing at a midpoint that still valued the company at $7 billion, the shares of King Digital had a treacherous first day out, spiraling almost 16 percent.
articles.abstract: After pricing at a midpoint that still valued the company at $7 billion, the shares of King Digital had a treacherous first day out, spiraling almost 16 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: Candy Crush Saga has been a smash hit, attracting tens of millions of players and generating spectacular profits for its developer, King Digital Entertainment.

articles.headline: Why Movie Streaming Sites So Fail to Satisfy
articles.snippet: At least until the end of this decade, viewers will have to navigate between multiple streaming services to watch the movie or TV show they want.
articles.abstract: At least until the end of this decade, viewers will have to navigate between multiple streaming services to watch the movie or TV show they want.
articles.lead_paragraph: A team of web designers recently released an astonishingly innovative app for streaming movies online. The program, Popcorn Time, worked a bit like Netflix, except it had one unusual, killer feature. It was full of movies you’d want to watch.

articles.headline: After Mountain’s Collapse, Uncertainty and Loss
articles.snippet: Teams began another day of looking for bodies amid a vast plain of mud and rubble in Snohomish County, Wash., as rain that began falling Tuesday was expected to continue.
articles.abstract: Teams began another day of looking for bodies amid a vast plain of mud and rubble in Snohomish County, Wash., as rain that began falling Tuesday was expected to continue.
articles.lead_paragraph: ARLINGTON, Wash. — Pam Sanford was waiting for news about her brother, Joseph Miller, among the missing since Saturday in the Oso landslide, when a police detective called asking for his dental records.
